title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX (AP) — The Phoenix Suns didn’t just beat the Sacramento Kings on their home floor. They unleashed a force of nature named Kevin Johnson, and the basketball world simply stopped to watch.

In a stunning, virtuoso performance, Johnson authored one of the most spectacular individual efforts in NBA history, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 47 points to power the Suns to a 100-88 victory. From the opening tip, it was clear this would be his night, his legacy.

Johnson was a blur of motion, a maestro conducting a one-man symphony against a helpless Kings defense. He attacked the rim with relentless fury, finishing with acrobatic layups high off the glass and drawing fouls at will. But his dominance wasn't confined to the paint. When Sacramento dared to sag off, Johnson buried them from the outside, a complete offensive arsenal on full, breathtaking display.

While Johnson’s scoring was historic, he remained the consummate floor general, dishing out 8 assists and orchestrating the offense with poise amidst his personal scoring explosion. His backcourt mate, Wesley Person, provided crucial support with 18 points, but tonight’s stage belonged to only one man.

The Kings, led by Corliss Williamson’s 18 points, had no answer. They were witnesses to a record-breaking event, a player so locked in that every possession held the potential for magic. As the final seconds ticked away, the scoreboard told the story of a Suns win, but the roar of the crowd was a tribute to the singular, unforgettable performance they had just witnessed from number 7. Kevin Johnson didn't just score 47 points; he seized a night and carved his name into the record books forever.
